An issue that must be addressed is that BuChE has a more prominent role than AChE in elderly people and in more advanced stages of Alzheimer’s disease
53 . Moreover, BuChE has also been reported to participate in amyloid plaques and neurofibrillary tangles-mediated neurodegeneration
54 . This means that compounds 11e–g could be useful not only for re-establishing the cognitive functionality of the patients (by increasing the levels of cholinesterase) but also for retarding or ameliorating neurotoxicity associated with amyloidogenesis in advanced stages of the disease.
